Olympic National Park.title: Olympic National Park
intro: Olympic National Park is on Washington's Olympic Peninsula in the Pacific Northwest. The park sprawls across several different ecosystems, from the dramatic peaks of the Olympic Mountains to old-growth forests. The summit of glacier-clad Mt. Olympus is popular with climbers, and hiking and backpacking trails cut through the park's rainforests and along its Pacific coastline.

At 1,442 square miles in size, Olympic National Park is larger than Rhode Island by 200 square miles, over half the size of Delaware, nearly twice as large as Great Smoky Mountain National Park, and 300 square miles larger than Yosemite. One road surrounds the park and to drive around the entire park takes nearly six full hours with no stops. Olympic National Park is also home to 49 peaks over 6,500 feet, many of which are rarely climbed due to difficult terrain and isolation. Over 600 miles of trails are waiting to be explored and enjoyed, the majority of which are designated wilderness by the National Park Service.
Olympic National Park.location: Jefferson, Clallam, Mason, and Grays Harbor counties

Seattle Great Wheel.siteFact: The West Coast's Tallest Ferris Wheel
Seattle Great Wheel.title: Seattle Great Wheel
intro: The Seattle Great Wheel is a fun destination for tourists to enjoy a waterfront view of the pacific ocean. With a 175  foot tall ferris wheel visitors get to experience the great view of downtown Seattle at new heights

Mount Rainier.title: Mount Rainier
intro: Mount Rainier is a great tourist destination for those who like to explore nature while getting in an excercise. With many sports such as hiking, snowboarding, and biking, exploring the 14,000 foot mountain is sure to become a healthy experience

Pike Place Market.title: Pike Place Market
intro: A bustling Market situated in the Heart of down town Seattle where you can buy the freshest produce, and seafood products. Also the host of many famous landmarks in Seattle such as the famous gum wall where tourists leave their mark on Seattle by placing their chewed up gum on a wall.

Golden Gate Bridge.siteFact: Most Famous Bridge in the World
Golden Gate Bridge.title: Golden Gate Bridge
intro: The Golden Gate Bridge is one of the engineering masterpieces of the 20th century. It is famous for it huge figure, shape, and color that provides an ethereal sense of beauty. The state of california itself is nicknamed after this bridge.

Space Needle.title: Space Needle
intro: Built in 1961, the Space Needle has become the symbol of Seattle, with millions of tourists visiting the collosal tower every year. The space needle is host to many restaurants, cultural shops, and parks for outside fun. Once you climb the top of the Space Needle, you get to see an amazing view of the entire downtown Seattle.
